subject: Law
title: Promissory Estoppel
description: A micro-lesson that makes Promissory Estoppel usable.

hook.text: Your employer promised a pension. You stayed 20 years. They revoke it. No contract, but a court may enforce it anyway.

buildup.text: Promissory estoppel enforces promises that lack consideration when someone reasonably relied on them.

discovery.text: Requirements: a clear promise, reasonable reliance by the promisee, and injustice if the promise isn't enforced.

twist.text: It's a substitute for consideration, not a replacement for all contract elements. Courts use it narrowly.

climax.text: Damages are often limited to reliance lossesâ€”what you spent because of the promiseâ€”not full expectation damages.

punchline.text: When a promise changes someone's life, breaking it has consequences.

quiz.question: What does promissory estoppel substitute for?
